results.title: Castle of the Angel: a camera visit to the historic Castel St Angelo in Rome
results.brief_description: A tour of the Castle St Angelo, historic Roman fortress built in 135 AD by the Emperor Hadrian, showing the great halls, the dungeons, music rooms, and the private chambers of the popes. Against the background of the castle, the narrator recalls some of the events of history which took place within and about the castle. The works of great sculptors and painters, which adorn the castle, are shown in the film.

results.title: Castle Combe comes to town
results.brief_description: The tranquility of Castle Combe, a village in Wiltshire, was shattered in 1966, when it was decided to film some sequences of “Dr Doolittle” there. Shows some of the filming, construction of the settings and discusses the effect of the Hollywood invasion on the appearance and the people of England’s prettiest village.

results.title: Casting in iron
results.brief_description: Elementary treatment illustrating how simple castings are made in an iron foundry. The following are illustrated: finishing the pattern; preparing the mould; melting the iron in a cupola furnace; pouring the molten metal; casting and final fettling.

results.title: Cast us not out: a film about old age
results.creator_credit: Richard Bigham, Richard Crewdson, Jewish Welfare Board and Samaritan Films
results.brief_description: Examines the plight of the old in our society, showing the work that is being done by such organizations as the Jewish Welfare Board to alleviate the problem. Experts present the harsh facts of aging and stress the unwillingness of society to confront them. Considers some of the problems of institutional care.

results.title: A Case study in mechanism (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Jackson, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: An examination of the benzyne mechanism for nucleophilic aromatic substitution. Queries whether SN1 or SN2 mechanisms for nucleophilic substitution at a saturated carbon atom can be applied at an unsaturated or aromatic carbon atom. Looks at evidence for a modified version of the SN2 mechanism.

results.title: The Case of the missing magnets
results.brief_description: Reviews the basic principles of human relations, and the problem of motivating employees to better teamwork, and productivity. A dramatization helps supervisors understand that discipline goes hand-in-hand with human relations in moulding an effective team.

results.title: A Case of suicide
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Katie, aged 17, commits suicide when her husband deserts her. The discussion with the intimates attempts to recognise the signs preceding the serious attempt at suicide and what can be done to avoid it happening.

results.title: A Case of depression
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the problems of diagnosing depression and treating it. Follows the experience of a suicidal patient through shock therapy and questions the effectiveness of this crude technique. Shows a leucotomy operation which cures a woman of a 9-year depression, but asks how much can be done for the ordinary depressed patient. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.

results.title: The Case of Barbara Parsons
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Rob Iveson, Labor Canada and Parker Film Associates
results.brief_description: Barbara Parsons, a recent employee, is promoted to a position ahead of Michael Blais a company employee of 19 years. Dramatizes a situation that could occur in any unionized workplace - the violation of a contract between management and labour and illustrates the four main steps of the grievance procedure.

results.title: A Case for shiftwork?
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: The case for and against shiftwork in industry. The film follows the investigation of a textile factory by a visiting consultant who produces a prima facie case for shiftwork while flashbacks show it was successfully introduced in other factories. Discussion with management and shop floor illuminate various systems of shiftwork and the organizational and human problems involved in its application.
